attributes.action: Dave Coppard Voice of the Pensioners
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Memorandum
To      Gordon Brown PM	
CC:	 
From:	Dave Coppard
Date:	10/07/08
Re:	Basic State Pension
Dear    Prime Minster

Question To Prime Minister

In view of the present and unforeseeable Economic Climate when does the Prime Minister intend to enhance The Basics State Pension to incorporate the Exorbitant Energy cost Pensioners face? Especially Kerosene used for Oil Fired Central Heating. According BERR or Malcolm Wicks MP the government targets for eradicating fuel poverty are 2016 - 18. It would appear the government advice to Pensioners is to switch suppliers. A one-off £50 winter fuel payment is an added insult to Pensioners integrity. Should not the Prime Minister place himself for one week into the role of a Pensioner, and see how he and his wife can manage with maximum allowances on a total of £181 per week. Would be interesting to see his prudent budget for this, as Pensioners we would all like to know, after years of forced to choose between Eat and Heat.

Dave Coppard
Voice of the Pensioners

rejection.details: Your title should be a clear call for action, preferably starting with a verb, and not a name or statement.
